current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the following resolution; which was considered and
			 agreed to

text.#text:
supports the
			 goals and ideals of

Whereas mucopolysaccharidosis (referred to in this
			 resolution as
Whereas the cellular damage caused by MPS—

adversely affects
			 the human body by damaging the heart, respiratory system, bones, internal
			 organs, and central nervous system; and

often results in
			 intellectual disabilities, short stature, corneal damage, joint stiffness, loss
			 of mobility, speech and hearing impairment, heart disease, hyperactivity,
			 chronic respiratory problems, and, most importantly, a drastically shortened
			 life span;

Whereas symptoms of MPS are usually not apparent at
			 birth;

Whereas research has resulted in the development of
			 limited treatments for some MPS diseases;

Whereas, despite the creation of new remedies, the
			 blood-brain barrier continues to be a significant impediment to effectively
			 treating the brain, which prevents the treatment of many of the symptoms of
			 MPS;

Whereas the quality of life of the individuals afflicted
			 with MPS, and the treatments available to those individuals, will be enhanced
			 through the development of early detection techniques and early
			 intervention;

Whereas treatments and research advancements for MPS are
			 limited by a lack of awareness about MPS diseases;

Whereas the lack of awareness about MPS diseases extends
			 to individuals within the medical community;

Whereas the development of effective therapies and a
			 potential cure for MPS diseases can be accomplished by increased awareness,
			 research, data collection, and information distribution: Now, therefore, be
			 it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 142 ATS: Designating May 15, 2013, as National MPS Awareness Day.
